resources.string: No ROMs found… press + to add some.
The storage drive (for example, SD card) containing game data is unavailable.
Skip one out of every how many frames?
May cause display lag; requires emulator restart
May improve performance; requires emulator restart

Developed by Willie Chang
Published by Yearbook Labs
WonderDroid is originally written by Daniel Palmer.
Licensed under GPL 2.0
This product includes other open-source software including ActionBarSherlock, Blip_Buffer, Bryan McPhail's NEC V30MZ emulator, Cygne, and Mednafen.
Original icon designed by Bostwickenator on DeviantArt.
Certain icons made by Freepik and Vaadin from www.flaticon.com, with typeface by Sammi De Guzman.
Japanese translation by volunteer users (thank you!).
If you are having performance issues, try changing the frame skip and sharpness first. If this does not help, or you are having another issue, please let us know. Thanks!
But don\'t worry, we\'ve copied the URL to your clipboard. Simply paste it into your browser\'s address bar.
The path ??? is unavailable. Please enter a different path in Preferences.
The path ??? is unavailable or read-only. Please enter a different path in Preferences.
Please turn on the file access permission for WonderDroid X in your device settings.
File access permission is required for reading ROMs.
Cannot load ROM. Please try again.
Warning: the state you are loading includes a cartridge save that is different from the current one. Replace your current cartridge save?

[1] State saving and loading are experimental features. We recommend you back up your cartridge saves in ??? regularly.\n[2] When loading a state, if its corresponding cartridge save is different from the current cartridge save, the latter will be replaced.\n[3] Loading a state occasionally causes the game to freeze or crash. If this happens, please try loading the state again.
For keyboards and other input peripherals
WonderDroid X is now WonderDroid Ultra! In addition to WonderSwan games, you will be able to play Game Gear, Turbografx 16 / PC Engine (cartridges only), and Neo Geo Pocket games.

Now, let\'s add your WonderSwan games from WonderDroid X to WonderDroid Ultra. On the next screen, please confirm your WonderDroid X ROMs folder. You won\'t need it anymore afterwards, because WonderDroid Ultra uses an internal folder to store games and save files.

Note: Game states from WonderDroid X are not compatible with WonderDroid Ultra and will not be transferred. If you have important game states, please contact us at http://yearbooklabs.com/support/ for assistance.
Please select a drive to store your games and save files. Make sure it has enough space.
Supported file extensions:\n.ws. .wsc, .gg, .pce, .ngp, .ngc, and .zip containing files with any of the preceding extensions. You can also add save files and game states for games already added.
Add all games in a folder
Due to restrictions set by Android, not all folders can be scanned.
You can also rescan the last folder you selected:
File already exists but overwrite is disabled

Files with identical names are not overwritten by default. If you want to overwrite the existing file, please turn on the switch labeled "Overwrite files with identical names" at the bottom of the Add Games screen.
Drive is inaccessible or unusable. If it\'s an SD card, make sure it\'s attached. Otherwise, select another drive to use.
Your save files may not have been transferred. Press +, then Select Folder, and choose your save folder.

We do not collect any usage data. However, to download box art for the game selection screen, it is necessary to transmit game titles to third-party services. This feature is optional; check the box below to opt out.
File already exists in a ZIP, which can only be overwritten by another ZIP.
Master System games are not supported, but Game Gear games are.
